entities: International Tribunal for the former Yugoslavia (ICTY)
International Residual Mechanism for Criminal Tribunals
summary:
The Security Council,

Reaffirming its determination to combat impunity for those responsible for serious international crimes, 

Adopted resolution 2130 (2013) on 18 December 2013.

The Council recalled previous resolutions on the International Tribunal for the former Yugoslavia (ICTY) and noted the commencement of the Mechanism's branch on 1 July 2013.

The Council:
1. Requests the ICTY to expedite its work to facilitate closure, noting trials and appeals may extend beyond 2014, despite the aim to complete proceedings by 31 December 2014.

2. Extends the terms of office of 18 permanent and ad litem judges at the ICTY until 31 December 2014 or completion of assigned cases, if sooner.

3. Urges States to cooperate fully with the ICTY and the Mechanism, including providing information.

4. Decides to remain seized of the matter.
